title.narrative: Women in the Greater Horn of Africa will be leading and defining the political sociocultural and economic agenda through a gender lens at all levels

description.narrative: A regional comparative review of Muslim family laws in Horn of Africa countries that builds an evidence base for advocating for legal reform

title.narrative: Number of Strategic Partners and its members with clear understanding of how to navigate national policy and legislative processes and human rights mechanisms

description.narrative: Conduct a Human rights & national legal framework training, identifying key laws to be targeted for reform by WROs/As across the 5 countries in the Horn of Africa

location.ref: Sudan, Ethiopia, Somalia, Somaliland, South Sudan

comment.narrative: In September 2021, in partnership with consortium partner NAGAAD, Musawah contracted resource persons to deliver a hybrid capacity building training to 30 national women’s rights activists and groups from Mogadishu and Hargeisa, including some from the NAGAAD team. The training addressed the differences and diversity of Qur’anic interpretations, juristic opinions and the conceptual tools that make gender reform possible in Muslim family law and practices.

title.narrative: Women's Rights Advocates/Organizations are able to propose legal and policy reforms
Number of Family/Muslim laws, policies and strategies on blocked, adopted or improved to eradicate all forms of violence against women and young women in public and private life

comment.narrative: Musawah completed Phase 1 (i.e. Review & Research) of the Country-Level Mapping of Muslim Family Laws, Policies and Practices for 4 out of 5 WCW project countries (Ethiopia, Sudan, South Sudan, Uganda, and Somalia & Somaliland) by December 2021. The mapping outlines the legal frameworks, policies and practices in target countries to illuminate opportunities for advocacy in country and support consortium members’ and advocates’ ability to advocate for family law reform in each country’s context. Musawah successfully reviewed and published 5 countries (Uganda, Ethiopia, South Sudan, Sudan, Somalia and Somaliland)

title.narrative: Number of Strategic partners and their members with improved attitudes and practices towards women’s voice, agency, leadership, and representative participation in decision-making processes
